title: Docs: Custom fonts not added in `pages/_document.js` will only load for a single page. This is discouraged. See: https://nextjs.org/docs/messages/no-page-custom-font

labels.name: Linting
labels.description: Related to `next lint` or ESLint with Next.js.

body:
### What is the documentation issue?

I see the following ESLint warning:

> Custom fonts not added in `pages/_document.js` will only load for a single page. This is discouraged. See: https://nextjs.org/docs/messages/no-page-custom-font

after adding this `link` in my `src/app/layout.tsx`:
```
<html lang="en">
  <head>
    <link rel="stylesheet" href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/css2?family=Material+Symbols+Rounded:opsz,wght,FILL,GRAD@20..48,100..700,0..1,-50..200&icon_names=..." />
  </head>
  // ...
</html>
```

The ESLint warning brings to https://nextjs.org/docs/messages/no-page-custom-font which currently suggests to 

> Create the file ./pages/_document.js ...

But I'm actually using the app router, not the pages router so I'm not sure if it's just the ESLint documentation that needs to be updated, the ESLint rule itself or something else.


### Is there any context that might help us understand?

N/A.

### Does the docs page already exist? Please link to it.

https://nextjs.org/docs/messages/no-page-custom-font
